com.whirvis.jraknet.client

Class RakNetClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.client.RakNetClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RakNetClientListener, RakNetPeerMessenger
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatClient

    public class RakNetClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements RakNetPeerMessenger, RakNetClientListener
    Used to connect to servers using the RakNet protocol.
    Since:
    JRakNet v1.0.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley
    See Also:
    RakNetClientListener, addListener(RakNetClientListener), connect(InetSocketAddress)

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_TRANSFER_UNIT_SIZES

        public static final int[] DEFAULT_TRANSFER_UNIT_SIZES
        The default maximum transfer unit sizes used by the client.

        These were chosen due to the maximum transfer unit sizes used by the Minecraft client during connection.

      • PING_BROADCAST_WAIT_MILLIS

        public static final long PING_BROADCAST_WAIT_MILLIS
        The amount of time to wait before the client broadcasts another ping to the local network and all added external servers.

        This was also determined based on Minecraft's frequency of broadcasting pings to servers.

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        address - the address the client will bind to during connection. A null address will have the client bind to the wildcard address along with the client giving Netty the responsibility of choosing which port to bind to.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(java.net.InetAddress address,
                    int port)
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address the client will bind to during connection. A null address will have the client bind to the wildcard address.
        port - the port the client will bind to during connection. A port of 0 will have the client give Netty the respsonsibility of choosing the port to bind to.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(java.net.InetAddress address)
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address the client will bind to during connection. A null address will have the client bind to the wildcard address.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address the client will bind to during connection. A null address will have the client bind to the wildcard address.
        port - the port the client will bind to during connection. A port of 0 will have the client give Netty the respsonsibility of choosing the port to bind to.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(java.lang.String host)
             throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address the client will bind to during connection. A null address will have the client bind to the wildcard address.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.

      • RakNetClient

        public RakNetClient(int port)
        Creates a RakNet client.
        Parameters:
        port - the port the client will bind to during creation. A port of 0 will have the client give Netty the respsonsibility of choosing the port to bind to.

      • addListener

        public final RakNetClient addListener(RakNetClientListener listener)
                               throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a RakNetClientListener to the client.

        Listeners are used to listen for events that occur relating to the client such as connecting to discovers, discovering local servers, and more.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add.
        Returns:
        the client.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the listener is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener is another client that is not the client itself.

      • addSelfListener

        public final RakNetClient addSelfListener()
        Adds the client to its own set of listeners, used when extending the RakNetClient directly.
        Returns:
        the client.
        See Also:

      • isRunning

        public final boolean isRunning()
        Returns whether or not the client is currently running.

        If it is running, this means that it is currently connecting to or is connected to a server.

        Returns:
        true if the client is running, false otherwise.

      • getAddress

        public java.net.InetSocketAddress getAddress()
        Returns the address the client is bound to.

        This will be the value supplied during client creation until the client has connected to a server using the connect(InetSocketAddress) method. Once the client has connected a server, the bind address will be changed to the address returned from the channel's Channel.localAddress() method.

        Returns:
        the address the client is bound to.

      • getInetAddress

        public java.net.InetAddress getInetAddress()
        Returns the IP address the client is bound to based on the address returned from getAddress().
        Returns:
        the IP address the client is bound to.

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port the client is bound to based on the address returned from getAddress().
        Returns:
        the port the client is bound to.

      • getMaximumTransferUnitSizes

        public final int[] getMaximumTransferUnitSizes()
        Returns the maximum transfer unit sizes the client will use during connection.
        Returns:
        the maximum transfer unit sizes the client will use during connection.

      • setMaximumTransferUnitSizes

        public final void setMaximumTransferUnitSizes(int... maximumTransferUnitSizes)
                                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                              java.lang.RuntimeException
        Sets the maximum transfer unit sizes that will be used by the client during connection.
        Parameters:
        maximumTransferUnitSizes - the maximum transfer unit sizes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the maximumTransferUnitSizes is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maximumTransferUnitSizes is empty or one of its values is less than .
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if determining the maximum transfer unit for the network card with the client's bind address was a failure or no valid maximum transfer unit could be located for the network card that the client's binding address is bound to.

      • getServer

        public final RakNetServerPeer getServer()
        Returns the peer of the server the client is currently connected to.
        Returns:
        the peer of the server the client is currently connected to, null if it is not connected to a server.

      • sendMessage

        public final EncapsulatedPacket sendMessage(Reliability reliability,
                                            int channel,
                                            Packet packet)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sends a message to the peer.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface RakNetPeerMessenger
        Parameters:
        reliability - the reliability of the packet.
        channel - the channel to send the packet on.
        packet - the packet to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet. This is normally not important, however it can be used for packet acknowledged and not acknowledged events if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is not connected to a server.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sends a Netty message over the channel raw.

        This should be used sparingly, as if it is used incorrectly it could break server peers entirely. In order to send a message to a peer, use one of the sendMessage() methods.

        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to send.
        address - the address to send the buffer to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buf, address, or IP address of address are null.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(Packet packet,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sends a Netty message over the channel raw.

        This should be used sparingly, as if it is used incorrectly it could break server peers entirely. In order to send a message to a peer, use one of the sendMessage() methods.

        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to send.
        address - the address to send the packet to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the packet, address, or IP address of address are null.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage(int packetId,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
                            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sends a Netty message over the channel raw.

        This should be used sparingly, as if it is used incorrectly it could break server peers entirely. In order to send a message to a peer, use one of the sendMessage() methods.

        Parameters:
        packetId - the packet ID to send.
        address - the address to send the packet to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address or IP address of address are null.

      • handleHandlerException

        protected final void handleHandlerException(java.net.InetSocketAddress address,
                                            java.lang.Throwable cause)
                                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Called by the RakNetClientHander when it catches a Throwable while handling a packet.
        Parameters:
        address - the address that caused the exception.
        cause - the Throwable caught by the handler.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the cause address or cause are null.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    RakNetException
        Connects the client to a server.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the server to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address or the IP address of the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is currently connected to a server.
        RakNetException - if an error occurs during connection or login.

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.net.InetAddress address,
                          int port)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          RakNetException
        Connects the client to a server.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address of the server to connect to.
        port - the port of the server to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the address is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not in between 0-65535.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is currently connected to a server.
        RakNetException - if an error occurs during connection or login.

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String host,
                          int port)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.net.UnknownHostException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          RakNetException
        Connects the client to a server.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address of the server to connect to.
        port - the port of the server to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the host is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is not within the range of 0-65535.
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if no IP address for the host could be found, or if a scope_id was specified for a global IPv6 address.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is currently connected to a server.
        RakNetException - if an error occurs during connection or login.

      • connect

        public final void connect(DiscoveredServer server)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          RakNetException
        Connects the the client to the discovered server.
        Parameters:
        server - the discovered server to connect to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the discovered server is null.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is currently connected to a server.
        RakNetException - if an error occurs during connection or login.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect(java.lang.String reason)
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Disconnects the client from the server.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason for disconnection. A null reason will have "Disconnected" be used as the reason instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is not connected to a server.

      • disconnect

        public final void disconnect(java.lang.Throwable reason)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Disconnects the client from the server.
        Parameters:
        reason - the reason for disconnection. A null reason will have "Disconnected" be used as the reason instead.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is not connected to a server.

        public final void disconnect()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Disconnects the client from the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the client is not connected to a server.
